AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS responses are lengthy and may be somewhat generic, but there is no clear evidence of broken templates, obviously incorrect guidance, or a customer-visible correction showing the AI was wrong. The guidance requested diagnostics and later discussed a plausible XML corruption cause, which is at least connected to the symptom (scheduled scans).
evidence: “We understand that scheduled scanning is not working and that this is causing significant business impact.”

“Key observations from your attachment: * The repeated scans and scheduling issues are linked to a date corruption in the <LastRecurringScan> tag within the toolcfg_agent.xml file on affected agents.”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There are multiple consecutive public ATLAS replies and no visible human responder, but the strongest triggers (customer asking for a human in a public comment, or the AI repeatedly re-asking for the same item after the customer publicly stated it was already provided) are not present in the customer-facing/public thread.
evidence: “Dear asim.mehmood, Thank you for contacting us… please provide the following: - GFI LanGuard diagnostic logs…”
“Dear asim.mehmood, Thank you for your candid feedback… To move quickly, please share the following…”
“Dear asim.mehmood, Thank you for your detailed feedback and for sharing the reference image and diagnostic logs…”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: In public replies, ATLAS acknowledges the referenced partner ticket and explicitly offers to reuse previously uploaded data, which is the opposite of forcing repetition. Any stronger “already provided / asked again” signals appear only in private customer comments, not in customer-facing/public content.
evidence: “We also note your reference to partner ticket 60166415 and the urgency of the situation.”
“If your partner has already uploaded these under ticket 60166415, please confirm the upload date/time so we can locate and use the same data internally, avoiding duplication.”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: No customer-facing evidence shows the customer waiting on support for days, asking for updates after silence, or support apologizing for delays. The only visible week-gap is between ATLAS public messages, not a staff delay after a customer public request.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: ATLAS includes a standard warning that the ticket will stay open for one week unless the customer responds/updates status, but there is no explicit closure/auto-closure notice shown in the text.
evidence: “This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Closed in the portal.”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While urgency/business impact is mentioned, the public record does not clearly show P1/SEV1/outage handling requirements being ignored (e.g., refusal to escalate, prolonged generic troubleshooting with no progression).
